title.narrative: GABON COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Project (SPRP)

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Gabon.

condition.narrative: ESCP: Per ESCP, the project grievance mechanism will be operational and adequately resourced no later than 30 days after the dateof effectiveness and will be maintained throughout the life of the project.

Schedule 2, Section I, B, 1: The Borrower shall by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt aProject operations manual (“Project Operations Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for Project implementation,including: administration and coordination; monitoring and evaluation; financial management, procurement and accounting procedures;social and environmental safeguards; corruption and fraud mitigation measures; a grievance redress mechanism, personal datacollection.

Schedule 2. Section I. A.4. Without limitation upon Sections I.A.2 and I.A.3 above, the Borrower shall, not later than one (1)month after the Effective Date, recruit an environmental specialist, a social specialist and a communications specialist underterms of reference and with qualifications and experience acceptable to the Bank.

Schedule 2. Section I. B. 1. The Borrower shall by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt aProject operations manual (“Project Operations Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for Project implementation,including: administration and coordination; monitoring and evaluation; financial management, procurement and accounting procedures;social and environmental safeguards; corruption and fraud mitigation measures; a grievance redress mechanism, personal datacollection and processing in accordance with applicable national law and good international practice, roles and responsibilitiesof Project implementation; and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of theProject in form and substance satisfactory to the Bank.

Schedule 2. Section I.D.1. The Borrower shall ensure that all activities carried out by the Military Health Services under theProject shall be under the control of the Ministry of Health and shall be undertaken exclusively for purposes related to theProject. Any goods, services, incremental Operating Costs and Training financed by the Loan proceeds to be used by or provided tothe Military Health Services shall be used or provided under the direction and control of the Ministry of Health and strictly inaccordance with the Project Operations Manual and other arrangements or protocols that the Bank may require for the carrying out ofsuch activities.

Schedule 2. Section I.D.2. The Borrower shall regularly report to the Bank on its proposed distribution plan for any equipment,materials, supplies and other goods procured under the Project, as well as the implementation of such plan, as part of the ProjectReports, or separately as the Bank may request. Furthermore, the Borrower shall ensure that any equipment, materials, supplies andother goods procured under the Project and distributed to the Borrower's military COVID-19 treatment facilities shall be equitablyused for the benefit of all COVID-19 patients, whether civilian or military.
